chinese: Yeah.我电话打得很多.
english: Yeah. I use the telephone a lot.

chinese: 事实上, 我上个月的电话费有125美元左右.
english: As a matter of fact. my phone bill last month was like $125

chinese: 我都有点吓坏了,
english: and that kind of freaked me out.

chinese: 所以我想我也许不该再用电话了.
english: so I thought maybe I should stop using the phone.

chinese: Er. 上班的时候我可能一个小时要打20分钟左右的电话,
english: Er. at work I'm probably on the phone about 20 minutes an hour.

chinese: um. 有长途的也有本地的.
english: um. both long distance and local.

chinese: 事实上,
english: and Actually.

chinese: 我大多数的朋友都非常忙, 平时不大见面,
english: most of my friends are really busy and so we don't get to see each other a lot.

chinese: 所以我们花很多时间在电话里交谈.
english: so we spend a lot of time talking on the phone.

chinese: 没错, 我常常在电话里谈生意.
english: Sure. I do a lot of my business over the phone.

chinese: Um. 与别人保持联系是相当重要的.
english: Um. it's pretty important for getting in touch with people.

chinese: 我过去写信写得更多.
english: I used to write a lot more letters.

chinese: 现在, 大多数情况下, 我就打电话了,
english: Now. probably. I call people up.

chinese: 尤其是打给我在加利福尼亚的兄弟,
english: especially my brother in California,

chinese: 和在纽约的父母,
english: and my parents in New York.

chinese: 在家的时候我可能会给我在国内的朋友们打长途电话,
english: And at home I probably make a long distance call to friends around the country.

chinese: Um. 一星期两到三次吧,
english: um. two or three times a week.

chinese: 另外, 我可能会在晚上打20分钟, 半个小时的电话.
english: and otherwise I'm probably on the phone 20 minutes. half an hour at night.

chinese: 是的, 我的意思是说在电话里谈生意的目的性要强得多.
english: Yes. I mean I think you're a lot more purposeful when you get on the phone to talk business.

chinese: 我是说, 你需要问的问题都已列好,
english: I mean. you have your questions all lined up.

chinese: 你知道你要的究竟是什么.
english: you know what exactly you're looking for.

chinese: 与人面对面交谈的时候,你, er.
english: When you meet someone personally. you. er.

chinese: 你看到他们的身体语言,
english: you see body language

chinese: 你可以从他们所说的话. 他们的想法以及他们的表情中感觉到你对他们的影响.
english: and you get a sense of how you're impacting them by what they say and what they think and how they look.

chinese: 但是, 在电话里与人交谈的时候,
english: But when you talk to someone on the phone.

chinese: 你就得更加认真仔细地听对方所说的话, 我觉得.
english: you have to really listen much more carefully. I think.

chinese: 从某些方面来说.
english: In some ways.

chinese: 在电话里交谈也许会比面对面的交谈更亲密一些.
english: maybe the phone can be even more intimate than when you meet.

chinese: 电话还有其他几个特点,
english: A couple of other features.

chinese: er. 如果. er. 有个电话进来了,
english: er. if. er. a call comes in.

chinese: 很显然, 电话应答机在你不在的时候就会替你接电话.
english: obviously answering machines which will take the call when you're not there.

chinese: 不过, 如果你没有接到某个电话,
english: but if you just miss a call.

chinese: 你可以先拨星号, 再拨69.
english: you can dial star and then 69

chinese: 这样你就可以回电话给刚才那个打电话给你的人.
english: and it'll call back whomever just called you.

chinese: 5到I0年前, 我记得人们觉得对着机器说话特别不自在,
english: Five or ten years ago. I remember how uncomfortable people were talking into machines and it's been.

chinese: 但有趣的是, 人们不再觉得是在和机器说话.
english: it's really interesting to see that it's gone from people talking to machines to really feel like.

chinese: 感觉就像自己的确是在与人交谈.
english: feeling like they're actually communicating with the person.
